title: Fix onboarding tour page scroll functionality after clicking Get Started

requirements.text: Fix the scroll functionality on the onboarding tour page that occurs after clicking the 'Get Started' button on the landing page. Diagnose and resolve the issue preventing vertical scrolling on the WelcomeScreen component and throughout the OnboardingFlow. Ensure the page content (including 'Welcome to NEXY MYNDIS' title, subtitle, feature grid with 4 items - Manage Your Plan, Find Providers, Track Goals, Stay Compliant - and Skip Tour button) is fully scrollable when content exceeds viewport height.

acceptanceCriteria: After clicking 'Get Started' on the landing page, the onboarding tour page loads without any scroll-blocking behavior
All content on the WelcomeScreen is vertically scrollable when it exceeds the viewport height
The page body or container does not have overflow:hidden or fixed positioning preventing scroll
The OnboardingFlow overlay component allows proper scrolling of its content
Users can scroll down to view all onboarding content including all four feature cards and the Skip Tour button
The scroll behavior works correctly on both desktop and mobile viewports

requirements.text: Inspect the OnboardingFlow component (frontend/src/components/onboarding/OnboardingFlow.tsx) and WelcomeScreen component (frontend/src/components/onboarding/WelcomeScreen.tsx) for CSS styles that may be preventing scrolling, such as fixed positioning on parent containers, overflow:hidden on body or wrapper elements, or height constraints that prevent content overflow. Remove or adjust these styles to restore normal scroll functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: OnboardingFlow wrapper allows scrolling and does not apply fixed positioning that breaks scroll
WelcomeScreen container has proper height and overflow settings to enable vertical scrolling
Body scroll lock (if implemented) is removed or properly configured to allow scrolling within the onboarding modal
All CSS position, overflow, and height properties are reviewed and corrected

requirements.text: Verify that the App.tsx component and router configuration do not inadvertently block scrolling when the onboarding flow is active. Ensure the ProfileSetup modal and OnboardingFlow overlay rendering logic allows proper document scrolling or implements internal scrolling correctly if using modal overlays.
acceptanceCriteria: The onboarding flow overlay or modal has scrollable content area if it uses fixed/absolute positioning
Document body scrolling is preserved or intentionally managed with overflow-auto on modal content containers
Navigation between onboarding steps maintains scroll functionality
The scroll issue does not recur when progressing through onboarding screens

constraints: Do not modify the Internet Identity authentication system (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts)
Do not modify the React Router configuration in ways that break existing navigation
Maintain all existing functionality of the onboarding flow including localStorage persistence and skip options
Do not alter the visual design or layout of the onboarding screens, only fix the scroll behavior
nonGoals: Redesigning the onboarding flow UI or content
Changing the onboarding flow logic or state management
Modifying unrelated components outside the onboarding system
Adding new features to the onboarding experience
